definition: stand-in/substitute/body double/stuntman/scapegoat/fall guy/to stand in for sb else
to substitute for/to take the place of/to replace/for/on behalf of/to stand in for
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
substitute actor (esp. in fights of theatrical stunts)/stuntman

sentences.english: When he fells for love, the understudy of love you are.
sentences.chinese: 當一個人愛上了愛情，你就成了他愛情的替身。

sentences.english: The golden snake swordsman still also fell in love with double.
sentences.chinese: 金蛇郎君也還是愛上了替身。

sentences.english: Dabao to others when the body double, oneself was beaten face is swollen.
sentences.chinese: 大寶給別人當上了替身演員，自己被打得臉都腫了。

sentences.english: However, even after searching frantically, they were unable to find suitable replacements.
sentences.chinese: 然而工作人員四處拼命尋找，卻找不到合適的替身。

sentences.english: The president has started using look-alikes during some public appearances.
sentences.chinese: 這個總統開始用他的替身在許多公共場合露面。

sentences.english: "One of mine?" the simulagent asked, alarmed.
sentences.chinese: “還有個我的人？”替身警覺地問着。

sentences.english: He used to stand in for the star.
sentences.chinese: 他過去一直在給明星做替身。

sentences.english: One student at Shenzhen University who identified himself as Qi works as a double.
sentences.chinese: 深圳大學的學生小齊就是一名代課替身。

sentences.english: He seldom uses a stunt man even for some dangerous thins scenes.
sentences.chinese: 他即使很危險的鏡頭也很少用替身演員。

sentences.english: Your stand-in objects will 'punch a hole' in the matte.
sentences.chinese: 你的替身對象將在影像形板中“鑽一個孔”。

sentences.english: Both Jacky Chan and Jet Li don't like to use stuntman in their films.
sentences.chinese: 成龍和李連杰在電影中都不愛用替身演員。

sentences.english: This is just a proxy for old-fashioned racism.
sentences.chinese: 這僅僅是一個老式的種族主義的替身。

to put on a play/to perform/fig. to pretend/to feign

cast and crew/performers and production team
to clip (an image)/image clipping
to appear on stage in an amateur capacity/(of a professional) to make a guest appearance/(fig.) to assume a role outside one's usual duties/to substitute for
to explode/spontaneous detonation/self-detonation/suicide bombing/to disclose private matters about oneself
supporting role (in play, film etc)/minor role/to play a secondary role (in business etc)/to play second fiddle
an extra (in a movie)
seat of honor/person in a high-ranking position/to be promoted to a more senior role/(genetics) epistatic
to replace
actor or actress/performer/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2]
role/character in a novel/persona/also pr. [jiao3 se4]
